page.title: 03Gamekeeping & Pheasantry ii
page.content: The area{Mr. Weekes}is responsible for is east of the track running down from {Berwick St John}to{Tollard Royal}. One of the problems is that the chemicals sprayed on the weeds kill many of the insects that the pheasants eat. Sheep and deer are also a problem as they eat the grain put out for the birds. He has to put out{snares}to catch the{foxes}and in the air,{magpies and {rooks}attack the young birds. Of all the predators the{fox}is the most dangerous. He rents his pheasantry from the{Pitt- {Rivers Estate}and he organises several shoots a year for a{Bournemouth}shoot- ing syndicate. He says it is a very interesting way of earning a living but there is not much profit in it. {(AUTHOR:C.Pope,A.Wood) {
